title: Zelensky Meets European Leaders In Paris To Finalise Ukraine Security Guarantees

title: This Woman's 'Vacation' Was A Secret Switzerland Trip For Assisted Suicide
content: An Irish woman, who told her family that she was going on a vacation, travelled to Switzerland to end her life. On July 8, Maureen Slough, 58, from Cavan, said that she was going to Lithuania with a friend.

title: Xi Holds Talks With North Korea's Kim Jong Un In Beijing
content: Chinese President Xi Jinping met with Kim Jong Un for talks on Thursday, state media reported as the North Korean leader was in Beijing on a rare foreign visit.

title: Video: Woman's Car Flips After She Sings 'Hit Me Baby One More Time'
content: A US woman singing a Britney Spears song while driving and filming a TikTok video crashed her car. Kaitlynn McCutcheon, a Pennsylvania nursing student, was singing along to Spears' iconic '...Hit me baby'when things took a dangerous turn.

content: Images this week of PM Modi holding hands with Russia's Vladimir Putin at a summit hosted by China's Xi Jinping seemed to confirm what many experts have already concluded - the US has stumbled in its effort to draw India into its diplomatic orbit.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Pakistan First? Then Azerbaijan Should Stop Complaining About India
content: Baku would do well to do some soul-searching as to why pursuing close relations with Pakistan should necessarily translate into antagonism towards India.

title: Big fight in US court: Trump cites India to justify tariff war
content: Donald Trump has appealed to the Supreme Court, challenging a federal court's decision that limits his power to impose tariffs on foreign imports. Trump defends tariffs on India for purchasing Russian energy, citing it as crucial for peace in Ukraine.

title: Sonia Gandhi voter ID row: Plea alleges she was listed 3 years before citizenship
content: A plea has been filed in a Delhi court seeking action against Sonia Gandhi, alleging her name appeared on the electoral rolls in 1980, three years before she officially became an Indian citizen in 1983. The complainant, Vikas Tripathi, through senior advocate Pavan Narang, argues this discrepancy suggests potential forgery and deception of public authorities.

title: Afghanistan earthquake: Toll crosses 2200, nearly 4000 injured; rescue under way
content: A devastating 6.0-magnitude earthquake in eastern Afghanistan has claimed over 2,200 lives and injured nearly 4,000, primarily in Kunar province. Rescue operations are ongoing amidst difficult terrain, complicated by aftershocks, including a 4.8-magnitude tremor. International aid is arriving, with India airlifting 21 tonnes of relief supplies to assist the affected population already struggling with fragile housing and decades of conflict.

title: WB assembly chaos: Mamata launches tirade; BJP MLAs dragged out, suspended
content: The West Bengal Assembly erupted in chaos as TMC and BJP MLAs clashed over a resolution addressing alleged atrocities against Bengali migrants. Chief minister Mamata Banerjee accused the BJP of being anti-Bengali and obstructing discussions on attacks in BJP-ruled states. Addressing the House, Banerjee accused the BJP of being against Bangla-speaking people.

title: GST rate cut: TVs, ACs, laptops see relief; what happens to mobile phones
content: The Goods and Services Tax Council approved new GST reforms. The council reduced the slabs to 5% and 18%. Nirmala Sitharaman announced the changes. The revised rates take effect from September 22. Consumer electronics like ACs and TVs will see a price cut. Mobile phone and laptop GST rates remain unchanged. Air conditioners and dishwashers will also become cheaper.

title: Confession without a corpse: Kozhikode's 5-year puzzle of a man lost in marshland
content: Five years after Vijil vanished from Kerala, his disappearance remains a perplexing mystery. Two friends confessed to burying him after a drug overdose at Sarovaram Park, but no remains have been found despite extensive searches. Vijil's parents dispute the drug story, suspecting foul play, leaving investigators grappling with a case shrouded in uncertainty and a family without closure.

title: 'I was very troubled by her': Man shoots wife dead in busy market in Gorakhpur
content: In Gorakhpur, Vishwakarma Chauhan fatally shot his wife, Mamta, in a public market on Jail Road. The incident occurred after an argument outside a photo studio where Mamta had gone.

title: Irfan Pathan vs Dhoni: After hookah, old Army gloves controversy storms back online
content: Irfan Pathan is facing renewed scrutiny after an old interview resurfaced where he suggested MS Dhoni favored players who joined him in smoking hookah, sparking controversy.

title: Google avoids a ‚Äòpainful breakup‚Äô: How Googlers celebrated
content: Google employees celebrated as a federal judge ruled the company could keep its Chrome browser, preventing a potential corporate breakup. The decision led to a surge in Google's stock and a flood of celebratory memes among employees. While Google avoided a forced sale of Chrome, the ruling requires them to share search data with competitors and end exclusive distribution deals.

title: NIRF 2025: AIIMS Delhi tops medical ranking; check top 10
content: The NIRF 2025 medical rankings have been released, with AIIMS Delhi maintaining its top position for the tenth consecutive year. The list highlights India‚Äôs leading medical institutes, including PGIMER Chandigarh and Christian Medical College, Vellore. Rankings are based on teaching quality, research, graduation outcomes, inclusivity, and perception. The top 10 includes both public and private institutions, reflecting India‚Äôs growing medical education landscape. This ranking serves as a key guide for prospective medical students.

title: Aligarh dowry horror: ‚ÄòJump‚Äô, dares hubby, woman leaps off 2nd floor
content: In Aligarh's Daunkoli village, Archana, a 35-year-old woman, allegedly jumped from her roof after enduring years of dowry-related abuse. A video surfaced showing the aftermath, leading to a police case against her husband and in-laws. They are accused of demanding additional dowry of Rs 5 lakh and a motorcycle.

title: 'Failed FM': Chandrasekhar's 'disgruntled' retort on Chidambaram's GST 'U-turn' claim
content: Kerala BJP president Rajeev Chandrasekhar strongly criticized Congress leader P. Chidambaram's remarks on the GST overhaul, labeling him a "dejected, disgruntled, and failed finance minister." This came after Chidambaram called the GST reforms a belated "U-turn," suggesting they should have occurred eight years prior.

title: Trump tariffs on digital taxes? Meta CEO raises concerns; semiconductors at risk
content: Donald Trump has threatened tariffs on nations imposing digital taxes, following concerns raised by Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg about European regulatory overreach. Trump, who once called Zuckerberg a 'criminal,' seems to have mended fences, evident from recent White House meetings and Meta's support for Trump's inauguration.

title: Punjab floods: Amid disaster, rail parts maker switches to boats
content: Hanspal Traders, a railway coach component manufacturer in Kapurthala, has shifted its operations to fabricate boats for Punjab flood relief. Prompted by calls from across the state and encouraged by an MLA, the company is also sharing its designs to involve other manufacturers. They aim to produce boats manually, focusing on aiding people and transporting essential supplies.

title: Asia Cup: India's Dubai schedule revealed - player arrivals, practice timings & more
content: Defending champions India are set to commence their Asia Cup 2025 preparations with practice sessions in Dubai, foregoing a preparatory camp in India. Players will assemble individually, with captain Suryakumar Yadav and coach Gautam Gambhir already en route. India's campaign begins against UAE on September 10, followed by a highly anticipated match against Pakistan on September 14.

title: Watch: BJP whip dragged out of Bengal assembly as Mamata shouts 'vote chor'
content: West Bengal Assembly witnessed chaos as Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee accused the BJP of corruption and anti-Bengali sentiment, triggering fierce opposition. BJP chief whip Shankar Ghosh was suspended for disrupting a discussion on Bengali migrants' rights. Marshals escorted Ghosh out after he refused to leave.

title: Minor rape survivor sent back to accused family by CWC, raped again; 10 booked
content: In Panna, Madhya Pradesh, police filed an FIR against ten individuals, including Child Welfare Committee members and officials from the women and child development department, under the POCSO and Juvenile Justice Acts. The action was prompted by the CWC's decision to return a minor rape survivor to the accused's family, leading to further abuse.

title: Magic of Bumrah: In a world of Messi vs Ronaldo, he is the Ibrahimovic - an outlier
content: Jasprit Bumrah thrives on challenges. He is a non-conformist. He has always chosen the unconventional route. While most athletes are swayed by the Messi-Ronaldo rivalry, his inspiration comes from Zlatan Ibrahimovic, a monster in his own right. During Covid-19, in an Instagram Live with Rohit Sharma, Bumrah had said: "I love Ibra. I can relate to his story that people did not take him seriously and then he became a star. I can relate as I think people took me lightly initially and then I proved them wrong, I am still trying."

title: Deion Sanders gives heartfelt fatherhood advice to Jaguars rookie Hunter
content: Deion Sanders offers heartfelt advice to Travis Hunter as he navigates fatherhood and his NFL career with the Jacksonville Jaguars. Their bond, forged at Jackson State and Colorado, transcends football. Sanders' guidance emphasizes correcting past shortcomings in fatherhood, reflecting their deep connection as Hunter embraces his roles as a husband, father, and rising NFL star.

title: Will Taylor Swift attend Travis Kelce and Chiefs game in Brazil on September 5
content: Travis Kelce will play in Brazil on September 5, 2025. Taylor Swift's presence is a big topic. She might attend the Chiefs vs Chargers game. Security arrangements are rumored. Swift's past experience in Brazil is a factor. She has supported Kelce at many games. Her new album releases on October 3. Her schedule might allow her to travel to Brazil.

title: CCTV footage exposes brutal police attack on Youth Congress member in Kerala
content: CCTV footage revealed the torture of a Youth Congress worker, V S Sujith, at Kunnamkulam police station, sparking protests and a human rights commission investigation. A magistrate ordered an inquiry against four officers after medical tests disproved police claims of Sujith's intoxication. While departmental action was taken against some officers, further action depends on the court's decision.

title: Delhi rains: Alipur flyover portion caves in
content: New Delhi faced disruptions due to heavy rainfall. A portion of the NH-44 flyover collapsed. Waterlogging and traffic jams were widespread. The Yamuna River exceeded the danger level. Chief Minister Rekha Gupta assessed the situation and assured assistance. The IMD forecasts more rain in the coming days. Interstate cooperation is underway to manage the crisis. Air quality remained satisfactory.

title: South Park mocks Trump again; shows Satan pregnant with his child
content: US president Donald Trump faced mockery in the recent South Park episode which aired on Wednesday. The show satirised Trump's relationship with Melania. It also depicted Satan's romantic involvement with Trump. Satan claimed pregnancy and an inability to leave Trump. The episode further included jokes on tariffs and the Labubu craze.

title: Peace in Manipur? Tripartite pact signed, NH-2 reopens; PM likely to visit soon
content: The Ministry of Home Affairs, Manipur government, and Kuki-Zo groups have signed a tripartite Suspension of Operations (SoO) agreement, aiming to restore peace after the ethnic conflict. Key provisions include maintaining Manipur's territorial integrity, reopening National Highway-2, and relocating militant camps. The agreement emphasizes a negotiated solution and strict enforcement of revised ground rules to ensure lasting stability.

title: Internal affairs: Why Delhi‚Äôs residential roads face a dead end
content: Internal roads in Delhi are in disrepair due to a lack of funds and ineffective schemes. The MCD faces a severe financial crunch, hindering road maintenance despite its responsibility for 12,700km of roads. Residents in areas like Green Park Extension and Laxmi Nagar express frustration over persistent potholes and delayed repairs, with temporary fixes proving inadequate.

title: ‚ÄòBJP begging before US, China‚Äô: Mamata‚Äôs jibe at Centre; alleges India‚Äôs prestige sold
content: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee accused the BJP-led Union government of compromising India's prestige by allegedly "begging" before foreign powers like the US and China. During a state assembly discussion on attacks against Bengali migrants, Banerjee alleged the BJP has a dictatorial mindset and aims to turn West Bengal into its colony.

title: Watch: Pope Leo rides BMW motorcycle in St Peter‚Äôs Square
content: Pope Leo XIV received a custom BMW motorcycle from the Christian Jesus Bikers, who rode from Germany to Rome as part of a Jubilee of Hope pilgrimage. The Pope blessed and signed the bike, which will be auctioned in Munich to benefit children working in mica mines in Madagascar. The Jesus Bikers have a history of presenting motorcycles to popes.

title: World Athletics: Arshad Nadeem fully fit; set for showdown with Neeraj Chopra
content: Arshad Nadeem, Pakistan's Olympic javelin champion, is declared fully fit after calf surgery, setting up a highly anticipated showdown with India's world champion Neeraj Chopra at the World Athletics Championships in Tokyo. Despite disrupted training due to heavy rains, Nadeem's coach confirms he is training vigorously. The rivalry between Chopra and Nadeem promises to be a major highlight.

title: CBSE portal for special needs students: Registration starts Sept 9; apply online
content: Central Board of Secondary Education sets the registration dates for Children With Special Needs. This is for the upcoming Class 10 and 12 board exams in 2026. Schools need to register eligible students on the Pariksha Sangam portal. The registration window is from September 9 to September 22, 2025. Registered students will receive accommodations during exams.

title: 40% tax rate in GST rejig: What are sin goods and why they are in highest slab?
content: The GST Council has approved a significant tax hike on sin and luxury goods, introducing a new 40% slab for items like tobacco, aerated drinks, and premium vehicles. This restructuring aims to simplify the indirect tax system by reducing the number of tax slabs.

title: 'I fear encounter': On the run, AAP MLA posts video from unknown location
content: Punjab Police are actively searching for AAP MLA Harmeet Singh Pathanmajra, who is accused of sexual exploitation and other charges. Pathanmajra released a video denying allegations of attacking police during an attempted arrest in Haryana.

title: NIRF 2025: IISc B'luru tops; JNU at number 2; see India‚Äôs top 10 universities
content: The NIRF 2025 rankings showcase India's leading universities. IISc Bengaluru secures the top spot, followed by JNU New Delhi. MAHE and Jamia Millia Islamia also perform well. These rankings guide students in choosing quality institutions. Private universities are rising, emphasizing research and global collaborations. The rankings consider inclusivity and community engagement. Students can find competitive programs in diverse institutions.

title: GST rate cuts & rationalisation: Top winners & losers of new tax slabs - check list
content: The GST Council has approved a restructured indirect tax system, effective September 22nd, featuring simplified rates of 5% and 18%, with a 40% category for luxury and sin goods. This reform eliminates the 12% and 28% slabs, aiming to streamline tax administration.

title: Shocking claims! 'I was depressed': Amit Mishra on career gap after retirement
content: Amit Mishra, the veteran leg-spinner, has retired from professional cricket after 25 years. He debuted in 2003 but faced a five-year gap due to strong competition. Mishra made a notable Test debut in 2008, claiming five wickets. Despite facing depression, he persevered, focusing on self-improvement. He ended his career with 156 international wickets.

title: Kansas City Chiefs game in Brazil highlights NFL‚Äôs $23bn plan for global expansion
content: Patrick Mahomes and Travis Kelce are in Sao Paulo. Kansas City Chiefs will face Los Angeles Chargers in Brazil. This marks the first NFL game this season outside the U.S. The NFL plans to expand globally. Games are scheduled in Brazil, Ireland, Germany, Spain, and the UK. The NFL aims to make the sport truly global.

title: Big Boss 19: Neelam Giri opens up about her troubled relationship
content: Kunickaa Sadanand, a contestant on Bigg Boss 19, has revealed details about her personal life, creating a buzz. She shared that she was in a 27-year live-in relationship with a married man who was separated from his wife. Kunickaa ended the relationship after discovering her partner was cheating on her, leading to mixed reactions from fans.

title: NIRF 2025 college rankings: Hindu College at No.1; here's the list of top 10
content: The Ministry of Education has released the NIRF Rankings 2025, with Hindu College securing the top spot among India‚Äôs best colleges, followed by Miranda House and Hans Raj College. Delhi University continues to dominate, but institutions from West Bengal and Tamil Nadu also feature in the top 10. A new SDG category highlights the rise of sustainable, socially responsible education.

title: PM Modi holds bilateral with Singapore PM; discuss Pahalgam attack
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Singaporean Prime Minister Lawrence Wong met in New Delhi, marking a significant step in the Comprehensive Strategic Partnership between India and Singapore. They addressed terrorism concerns, inaugurated the second phase of PSA International‚Äôs Mumbai Container Terminal, and announced cooperation in green and digital shipping corridors.

title: GST revamp: Kharge hits out at Centre with ‚Äòone nation, 9 taxes‚Äô jibe
content: Congress has criticized the Centre's GST celebrations, alleging the tax system has become overly complex with multiple slabs, contrary to the original vision. The party highlighted its past advocacy for a simplified GST 2.0, accusing the government of belatedly adopting their suggestions for rate cuts and rationalization. The recent GST Council meeting introduced a two-tier structure, marking a significant revamp.

title: GST rate cut on cement, materials: Home prices to dip; move to boost housing demand
content: The GST Council's decision to lower tax rates on cement and granite is being hailed by the real estate sector as a landmark reform. This move is expected to boost housing affordability and demand during the festive season. Developers anticipate reduced construction costs, faster project delivery, and renewed hope for homebuyers seeking affordable prices.

title: Dream11 effect: India jerseys being sold at 80% discount; here's how much they cost
content: Indian cricket team's jersey manufacturer Adidas is offering massive discounts, up to 80%, on Indian cricket team jerseys, bringing the price down to as much as Rs 1,199. This follows Dream11's early exit as the team's sponsor due to new online gaming regulations.

title: GST rate cuts a booster shot! What do tax changes mean for stock markets? Explained
content: The Modi government's GST rate cuts are injecting vitality into the Indian economy, potentially offsetting US tariffs. Nirmala Sitharaman's reforms, impacting various sectors, sparked a Sensex surge. Analysts predict increased consumption, benefiting auto, FMCG, and cement industries.

title: GST revamp: Life & health cover, white goods, most cars to get cheaper
content: The GST Council has approved a major overhaul of the indirect tax system, introducing a simplified two-rate structure of 5% and 18%, along with a 40% slab for select goods. Effective September 22nd, these changes aim to reduce tax burdens on common goods, eliminate classification disputes, and boost consumption.

content: "my wife absolutely kills it, and hopefully, award season coming around, people make the right decision," Allen says . he says he was just so proud of his wife, actress and singer hailee Steinfeld's performance . "it was a lot of different aspects of life," Allen said in an interview .

title: Who can book their place at the 2026 World Cup this week
content: all confederations are drawing to a close, but we're a long way from discovering the list of 45 nations who will join hosts United States , Mexico and Canada to make up the full field of 48 . Mauricio pochettino scored the very first goal in a 5-1 win over Macau .

title: Tennessee flips help Vols surge into top 10
content: Lamar Brown commits to play for the LSU Tigers . the 2025 season is underway . programs are building and solidifying their 2026 classes . Tennessee is proof of a strong 2026 recruiting world in the recruiting world .

title: Way-Too-Early Top 25 rankings: Every team's top awards candidate
content: college basketball is just around the corner . it was another quiet month for college hoops . the top 25 from the July and August editions remains the same . we're focusing on one candidate from each Top 25 team .

title: Bottom 10: Tide got rolled -- but Bama isn't the only Power 4 stinker
content: Rich Eisen shares his thoughts with Stephen A. Smith on bill Belichick's coaching debut with UNC . content: new: n.c. coach bill Belichick stepped in with a substantial financial figure of its own . new: bill belichick and rob Gronkowski face a sizable bid for a new coach . the new coach says he's not going to give up a touchdown . he is preparing for the game against no. 14 Michigan next week .

title: 14 teams that will make the NFL playoffs -- and six that will be left out: Barnwell‚Äôs picks
content: a lot of weird things can happen in a 17-game season . 13 of the 14 teams that made the playoffs last season are favorites to make it back again . the Steelers are the lone exception .
